text:
Looking at these two images of a historical German letter, I can identify the following information:

From the first page:
- Date: "Basel, den 24. Mai 1938" (Basel, May 24, 1938)
- Recipient: "Herrn Direktor Werner Stauffacher, Präsident des Vereins für die Schiffahrt auf dem Oberrhein, Basel"
- Opening: "Sehr geehrter Herr,"

From the second page:
- Closing signature appears to show "Ihr ergebener" followed by what seems to be a signature
- There are "3 Beilagen" (3 attachments) mentioned

The letter appears to be formal correspondence about shipping/navigation matters on the Upper Rhine.
